question.title: What is the primary purpose of radiography in the field of microcrystalline arthropathies?

option_a.title: To diagnose joint effusions and synovitis

option_b.title: To assess the integrity of the joint capsule and ligaments

option_c.title: To evaluate the presence of calcifications in the pubic symphysis and femoral cartilages

option_d.title: To detect bone marrow edema and bone marrow space narrowing

correct_option.title: To evaluate the presence of calcifications in the pubic symphysis and femoral cartilages
correct_option.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option
